data.enText: any infectious disease that kills a lot of people

data.chText: 艾滋病这种严重的传染病
（老鼠或昆虫等肆虐造成的）灾害，祸患
data.enText: large numbers of an animal or insect that come into an area and cause great damage

data.chText: 像避瘟疫似地躲着某人（或某事物）；尽量避开某人（或某事物）
data.enText: to try very hard not to meet sb, do sth, etc.

data.chText: 给…造成长时间的痛苦（或麻烦）；困扰；折磨；使受煎熬
data.enText: to cause pain or trouble to sb/sth over a period of time

data.chText: 财政问题使这家公司焦头烂额。
data.enText: Financial problems are plaguing the company.

data.chText: 本赛季这支队一直为队员受伤所困扰。
data.enText: The team has been plagued by injury this season.
to annoy sb or create problems, especially by asking for sth, demanding attention, etc.

data.chText: 摇滚歌星必须习惯歌迷要求签名的纠缠。
data.enText: Rock stars have to get used to being plagued by autograph hunters.

means: (老鼠或昆虫等肆虐造成的)灾害，祸患
给…造成长时间的痛苦(或麻烦)

ex.chText: 用工荒继续困扰该地区。
ex.enText: Labour shortages continued to plague that area.

synonyms.bx: 指糟糕的事情（如病痛、问题等）在很长一段时间内不断困扰某个人、组织、地区等，通常用被动语态。

ex.chText: 那个国家20%左右的居民饱受饥荒之苦。
ex.enText: About 20% of that country's population is afflicted by famine.

ex.chText: 世界上有多少人为关节炎所折磨？
ex.enText: How many people around the world are afflicted with arthritis?

synonyms.bx: 指疾病、战争、贫困等让某人、某地区等饱受折磨，常用被动语态。

ex.chText: 罢工给公司造成了巨大损失。
ex.enText: The strikes inflicted serious damage on the company.

ex.chText: 尽管暴风雪造成了各种损失，农民依然得交租。
ex.enText: Peasants still had to pay the rent despite all of the damage inflicted by the storm.

synonyms.bx: 指使人、机构、地区等遭受不愉快的事。

data.chText: 像避瘟疫似地躲着某人（或某事物）；尽量避开某人（或某事物）
data.enText: to try very hard not to meet sb, do sth, etc.

example: those children are a damn plague

tr: any large scale calamity (especially when thought to be sent by God)
a swarm of insects that attack plants
any epidemic disease with a high death rate
a serious (sometimes fatal) infection of rodents caused by Yersinia pestis and accidentally transmitted to humans by the bite of a flea that has bitten an infected animal

example: He is known to harry his staff when he is overworked
This man harasses his female co-workers
Too much rain may blight the garden with mold

value.def: A plague is a very infectious disease that spreads quickly and kills large numbers of people.

example.ex: A cholera plague had been killing many prisoners of war at the time.
example.tran: 当时霍乱疫情已在夺去很多战俘的生命。

value.def: Plague or the plague is a very infectious disease which usually results in death. The patient has a severe fever and swellings on his or her body.

example.ex: ...illnesses such as smallpox, typhus and the plague.
example.tran: 像天花、伤寒和鼠疫这样的疾病

value.def: A plague of unpleasant things is a large number of them that arrive or happen at the same time.

example.ex: The city is under threat from a plague of rats...
example.tran: 该市处于鼠患的威胁之下。

example.ex: Last year there was a plague of robbery and housebreaking.
example.tran: 去年抢劫和入室行窃成灾。

value.tran: （某一事物肆虐造成的）灾难，祸患

value.def: If you describe something as a plague, you mean that it causes a great deal of trouble or harm.

example.ex: Inflation will remain a recurrent plague...
example.tran: 通货膨胀将继续成为周期性的烦扰。

example.ex: Tim seems to have escaped the cynicism which is the absolute plague of our generation.
example.tran: 蒂姆好像并没有染上我们这代人愤世嫉俗的通病。

value.def: If you are plagued by unpleasant things, they continually cause you a lot of trouble or suffering.

example.ex: She was plagued by weakness, fatigue, and dizziness...
example.tran: 她感觉体虚、疲倦、头昏眼花。

example.ex: Fears about job security plague nearly half the workforce.
example.tran: 几乎一半的员工担心失业。

value.def: If someone plagues you, they keep bothering you or asking you for something.

example.ex: I'm not going to plague you with a lot more questions, Miss Culver...
example.tran: 卡尔弗小姐，我不会再问更多的问题来烦你了。

example.ex: Tommy Cook had been plaguing Pinner for months.
example.tran: 汤米·库克已纠缠平纳好几个月了。

value.def: If you say that you avoid someone or something like the plague, you are emphasizing that you deliberately avoid them completely.

example.ex: I would avoid him like the plague when his wife and my parents were around...
example.tran: 他的妻子和我的父母在旁边时，我会极力躲着他。

example.ex: I normally avoid cheap wine like the plague.
example.tran: 我一般对廉价的葡萄酒敬而远之。

value.def: You say a plague on a particular person or thing when you are very irritated by them and do not want to bother with them any more.

example.ex: A plague on you and your damned percentages!
example.tran: 你和你该死的百分比都见鬼去吧！
